Company Overview

This empowers our clients to better understand the unique needs of the communities they serve and enables them to build the most effective marketing/communications efforts, driven by a high and demonstrable return on investment. Although real-time analytics and visualizations are key to our service offerings, we are not a dashboard company. Our team members work closely with our clients, we understand their challenges, and we partner with them to help them succeed. The AlphaVu team consists of individuals who are curious, investigatory, collegial, and well-rounded.

Job Description

AlphaVu is seeking an Associate Insights Analyst for our DC office to work alongside the Director of Client Engagement and our analyst team, focusing on client project management within the public transportation and government sectors. Key responsibilities include managing client deliverables, helping lead client meetings, and ensuring client satisfaction by providing timely, actionable insights to our customers. The ideal candidate will possess extensive knowledge of the public transportation or governmental sectors, with proven expertise in public information and communication campaigns. They will also have strong technical skillset and be able to generate analytic reports using both quantitative and qualitative analysis. As a new and vital role in our expanding company, the Associate Insights Analyst will play a critical part in strengthening and growing our client relationships in the public sector.

We are a small yet growing business, led by our Founder/CEO Scott Wilkinson and Director of Client Engagement Zach Hernandez. Team members should be comfortable working in a small office setting and feel motivated to pitch in during various aspects of our business development and marketing, including but not limited to social media content, blog posts, and industry conferences. Candidates should be able to manage work independently, enthusiastically contribute to team projects, and be adaptable to the immediate needs of a small business.

Responsibilities

  • Help lead client calls and in-person meetings, effectively communicating value to customers and demonstrating expertise in public communications.
  • Assist the Director of Client Engagement in developing client resource materials and leading training sessions with customers.
  • Support AlphaVu’s business development by helping compile case studies and engaging prospective clients in pitches and industry events.
  • Use data exploration tools including Kibana/Elasticsearch, Tableau, R, SQL, and Excel to analyze large and continually evolving sets of client public engagement data.
  • Assist in writing JSON and SQL queries within our AWS cloud infrastructure environment for automated data monitoring and topic coding.
  • Help monitor client public engagement channels and write concise summaries of relevant online conversations and sentiment trends in a timely manner.
  • Generate visual reports and written memos summarizing analytics and recommendations in a succinct and appealing format.
  • Study social media and other emerging data sources to generate qualitative analysis.
  • Help manage client paid outreach campaigns and make recommendations based on performance analytics.
  • Help develop internal marketing and communication materials including blog posts, social media content, paid outreach campaigns, and assist in industry conference appearances.

Required Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree in a relevant field.
  • 1-4 years of relevant work experience.
  • Strong communication skills, including excellent verbal presentation capabilities in a client and industry setting.
  • Exhibited ability to synthesize complex ideas into clear, succinct, business writing.
  • Strong analytic thinking skills and experience with quantitative and qualitative analysis.
  • Understanding of digital marketing platforms (Google Ads, Facebook Ads Manager, etc.) and social media performance analytics.
  • Proficient with Excel, Word, and Google Suite.
  • Familiarity with project management software like Notion to oversee client projects and track progress.
  • Ability to work both independently and in teams as required.
  • Passion for pitching in, working across boundaries, and operating outside narrowly defined roles in a small and growing company.
  • Very self-motivated, highly organized, pays attention to detail, and able to quickly master new skills and techniques.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Relevant work experience at a public transportation agency or in a client management role focusing on the public sector.
  • Proficiency in business intelligence software such as Tableau or QuickSight for analyzing client engagement data, managing dashboards, and creating reports.
  • Familiarity with JSON, SQL, and Python basics.

Benefits

  • $80,000 - $100,000 annual salary, commensurate with experience.
  • 401(k) with matching of up to 3% of gross income.
  • 100% healthcare premium based on bronze reference plan.
  • Public transit compensation of $120/month.
  • 2 weeks of vacation, vesting after first 6 months of employment. Additional week vacation accompanying annual company closure Dec 24-Jan 1.

Application Materials

  • Candidates must submit a resume and cover letter with each application, or the application will not be considered.
  • The cover letter must demonstrate a clear understanding of the company goals, job description, and how you intend to apply your past experiences and current skillset to the position. Please keep resumes and covers letters to one-page each.
  • Please PDF your materials and email to zachary@alphavu.com with “Associate Insights Analyst” in the subject line.
  • We will begin reaching out to candidates in mid to late February.

Title: Lead Data Analyst
Description:
Vanguard's Chief Data and Analytics Office (CDAO) Institutional Inventor Group (IIG) is looking for a Lead Data Analyst to support our Institutional Sales and Service organizations. This role will consult with Senior Leadership to build analytics that drive IIG's Growth Strategy.

In this role you will provide:

Collaboration: Ability to work across Business lines and Data teams on process and data needs

Business Alignment: The analyst will have the responsibility of developing expertise in key subject areas of the IIG Sales & Service businesses (e.g., Client Success, Client Engagement Groups, SPO).

Technical Alignment: Own and drive a specific OKR's for the team.

An advanced technical Toolkit: Python, SQL, Tableau, AWS

Maintain soft skills: Analytics Consultation, Senior Leader Relationship Management, Data and Analytics Product Ownership, Storytelling

The Lead Data Analyst will analyze data, assess trends, and develop actionable insights and recommendations in support of large strategic business initiatives awhile actively developing the analytics community at Vanguard by coaching others internally and participating in external events.

Core Responsibilities


 Engages with internal partners to understand business strategy, questions and goals. Brings structure to business requests, translates requirements into an analytical project approach, and leads complex projects through completion. Delegates tasks and provides tactical and strategic guidance to peers. Serves as the analytics expert on cross-functional teams for large strategic initiatives. Acquires and compiles structured and unstructured data and verifies its quality, accuracy and reasonableness. Performs analyses of historical data to surface trends and insights using advanced analytical methods. Validates analytical techniques employed by other analysts. Prepares and delivers expert level visualizations and internal presentations that translate analytic insights into tangible, actionable solutions for business partners to implement. Develops, owns and manages recurring analytic or reporting processes. Actively develops the analytics community at Vanguard by mentoring, coaching and connecting others with resources and training. Participates and presents during scheduled analytics seminars. Participates in special projects and performs other duties as assigned.


Qualifications


Minimum of five years related work experience.Undergraduate degree or equivalent combination of training and experience. Graduate degree preferred.


Special Factors

Sponsorship

Vanguard is not offering visa sponsorship for this position.

About Vanguard

We are Vanguard. Together, we’re changing the way the world invests.

For us, investing doesn’t just end in value. It starts with values. Because when you invest with courage, when you invest with clarity, and when you invest with care, you can get so much more in return. We invest with purpose – and that’s how we’ve become a global market leader. Here, we grow by doing the right thing for the people we serve. And so can you.

We want to make success accessible to everyone. This is our opportunity. Let’s make it count.

Inclusion Statement

Vanguard’s continued commitment to diversity and inclusion is firmly rooted in our culture. Every decision we make to best serve our clients, crew (internally employees are referred to as crew), and communities is guided by one simple statement: “Do the right thing.”

We believe that a critical aspect of doing the right thing requires building diverse, inclusive, and highly effective teams of individuals who are as unique as the clients they serve. We empower our crew to contribute their distinct strengths to achieving Vanguard’s core purpose through our values.

When all crew members feel valued and included, our ability to collaborate and innovate is amplified, and we are united in delivering on Vanguard's core purpose.

Our core purpose: To take a stand for all investors, to treat them fairly, and to give them the best chance for investment success.

How We Work

Vanguard has implemented a hybrid working model for the majority of our crew members, designed to capture the benefits of enhanced flexibility while enabling in-person learning, collaboration, and connection. We believe our mission-driven and highly collaborative culture is a critical enabler to support long-term client outcomes and enrich the employee experience.

Two (2) years of professional experience, in a project management, customer experience measurement, or analytics role(s)One (1) year experience utilizing and configuring guest experience management tools, such as Qualtrics or Medallia.

Title: Lead Insights Analyst
Description:
The Lead Insights Analyst i s a professional track role whose primary role is to identify, generate, and communicate insights for an assigned scope of business through the blending, transformation, and critical evaluation of data. This role will perform these duties through descriptive, diagnostic, and limited predictive methods, relying on CFA’s established analytics tooling stack. This role will be expected to provide analytical support for multiple related projects or workstreams within Field Operations. It will require acting as a Subject Matter Expert in a broad suite of standard data, methods, and tools, including complex features. The Lead Insights Analyst will work under the direction of the Sr. Principal Team Leader over ED&A Service working with Field Operations.

The Lead Insights Analyst will work within a full stack analytics team to provide data and analytical support for Field Operations, including the use of data to understand and evaluate prioritized work from Field Operations Leadership such as the pipeline of Operator candidates, Grand Opening Restaurant performance, Staffing Models, and Smart Shop visits.

Our Flexible Future model offers a healthy mix of working in person and remotely, strengthening key elements of the Chick-fil-A culture by fostering collaboration and community.

Responsibilities

 Works within a team of data engineers, data scientists, and a Principal client lead to convert business problems/questions from Field Operations into effective analytics reports and insights. This role will primarily be responsible for insightful Tableau and/or ThoughtSpot Visualizations, finding and building data to be retrieved via SQL, and data curation via Alteryx or similar for single dashboard presentations or ad hoc analyses.  Demonstrates in-depth knowledge of and understands risk/safety implications to the broader business, strong knowledge of Chick-fil-A’s business and restaurant industry, including use and calculation of relevant Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and benchmarks  Persuasively recommends insights-informed action to leaders and peers across multiple business areas  Works comfortably with large and complex datasets that span multiple areas of the organization, and understands how to blend and model data effectively  Solves complex analytics problems requiring synthesis of diverse inputs from internal and external sources through the application of a comprehensive suite of descriptive and diagnostic methods and select predictive methods, with minimal oversight  Confidently leverages a broad suite of standard analytics tooling that may require unique or complex integrations across systems while coaching others to do the same, including Tableau, Alteryx, ThoughtSpot, and AWS services  Acts as subject matter expert for standard data usage patterns, analytics tooling and analytic methods and procedures while coaching others within the analytics community to do the same 

Minimum Qualifications

 Proficient with Tableau or similar data visualization tools  Comfort with Alteryx or similar ETL platforms  Strong SQL programming skills  Familiarity with cloud data storage and compute concepts, particularly AWS S3 and Redshift  Strong applied knowledge of basic statistical concepts and data best practices  Demonstrated ability to produce scalable and repeatable analytic processes  Demonstrated ability to partner with peers and leaders using strong written and verbal communication  Fast learner with a desire to gain new and improve existing analytic skills  Comfort and ability to ask questions and seek assistance when necessary 

Preferred Qualifications

 Experience providing data or analytical support for risk, travel, or security functions  Familiarity with ThoughtSpot Business Intelligence solution  General awareness of a breadth of cloud compute concepts and capabilities  Strong understanding of data governance principles and procedures  Strong statistical programming skills in R or Python  5+ years experience

Location: Atlanta, GA (Hybrid Opportunity: 2 - 3 days onsite)

About Block+Tackle:

At Block Tackle, we bring to the table a straightforward blend of expertise in customer strategy, ecosystem architecture, experience operations, and marketing sciences that's as unapologetic as it is effective. We're the silent game changers, the behind-the-scenes composers guiding our clients to build the capabilities to deliver customer experiences that leave their competitors eating dust.

Our skill set? Hard-earned and battle-tested over years of pushing boundaries and questioning the status quo. We dive deep into the trenches, slicing through the BS to optimize strategies, tools, data, and operations like a hot knife through butter, because let's face it, if content is king, context is the queen in the marketing chess game.

Our mission? To arm our clients with solutions that aren't just pie-in-the-sky ideas but are grounded, functional, and technically bulletproof. We're here to make the impossible, possible – without the fluff, without the filler. Welcome to Block Tackle – where we do things differently, and we're damn proud of it.

Job Overview:

We are seeking a skilled Data Analyst with a focus on Reporting and Insights, specializing in analyzing marketing data. The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of data analysis tools and techniques, with the ability to turn complex data into actionable insights that drive our marketing strategies forward.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Analyze Marketing Data: Dive deep into marketing campaign performance, customer behavior, and market trends to provide comprehensive analyses.
  • Develop Reports: Create regular reports on marketing metrics, including but not limited to ROI, conversion rates, and customer engagement.
  • Provide Insights: Offer strategic recommendations based on data findings to optimize marketing efforts and increase efficiency.
  • Collaborate with Teams: Work closely with the marketing team to understand goals and objectives, ensuring data analysis is aligned with business needs.
  • Data Visualization: Design and present clear visualizations (charts, graphs) to illustrate complex data in an understandable way.
  • Monitor Performance: Track the effectiveness of marketing initiatives and forecast future performance.
  • Maintain Data Integrity: Ensure accuracy and consistency of data across multiple platforms and sources.

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, or related field.
  • Proven experience as a data analyst, preferably within a marketing context.
  • Strong proficiency in data analysis software (e.g., Excel, SQL, R, Python).
  • Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
  • Excellent analytical skills with an attention to detail.
  • Ability to communicate complex data in a clear and concise manner.
  • Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to think critically.

Title: Senior Quantitative UX Researcher, Google Cloud
Description:
Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: Seattle, WA, USA; Cambridge, MA, USA; Kirkland, WA, USA; New York, NY, USA; Pittsburgh, PA, USA.Minimum qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Human-Computer Interaction, Cognitive Science, Statistics, Psychology, Anthropology, related field, or equivalent practical experience. 5 years of experience in an applied research setting, or similar. Experience in programming languages used for data manipulation and computational statistics (Python, R, MATLAB, C++, Java, Go), and with SQL. Product research experience in an applied research setting. 

Preferred qualifications:

Master's or PhD degree in Human-Computer Interaction, Cognitive Science, Statistics, Psychology, Anthropology, or related field. 5 years of experience conducting UX research on products and working with executive leadership (e.g., Director level and above). 3 years of experience managing projects, and working in a large, matrixed organization. Excellent command of research questions within a given domain, and of technical tools for the analysis of data within that field. Proficiency in programming computational and statistical algorithms for large data sets. Demonstrated expertise in descriptive, inferential, and multivariate statistics, including t-test and ANOVA, and experimental design. 

About The Job

At Google, we follow a simple but vital premise: "Focus on the user and all else will follow." Quantitative User Experience Researchers make this possible.

Google User Experience (UX) is made up of multi-disciplinary teams of UX Designers, Researchers, Writers, Content Strategists, Program Managers, and Engineers who care deeply about the people who use our products. The UX team plays an integral part in gathering insights about the attitudes, emotions, needs, and behaviors of people who use our products to inspire and inform design. We collaborate closely with each other and with engineering and product management to create industry-leading products that deliver value for the people who use them, and for Google’s businesses.

As a Quantitative User Experience Researcher (Quant UXR), you’ll help inform your team of UXers, product managers, and engineers about user needs. You’ll play a critical role in creating useful, usable, and delightful products. You’ll work with stakeholders across functions and levels and have impact at all stages of product development.

You will investigate user behavior and user needs using empirical research methods such as logs analysis, survey research, path modeling, and regression analysis. Quant UXRs vary in background using skills from computer science, quantitative social science, econometrics, data science, survey research, psychology, human-computer interaction, and other fields. You’ll combine skills in behavioral research design, statistical methods, and general programming to improve user experience.

The Quant UXR community at Google will help you do your best work. You’ll have the opportunity to work with and learn from UXRs across Google through regular meetups, mentor programs, and access to internal research tools.

Google Cloud accelerates organizations’ ability to digitally transform their business with the best infrastructure, platform, industry solutions and expertise. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology – all on the cleanest cloud in the industry. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.

The US base salary range for this full-time position is $139,000-$208,000 + bonus + equity + benefits. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location. The range displayed on each job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire salaries for the position across all US locations. Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range for your preferred location during the hiring process.

Please note that the compensation details listed in US role postings reflect the base salary only, and do not include bonus, equity, or benefits. Learn more about benefits at Google .

Responsibilities

Define and measure quantitative UX goals and metrics in collaboration with Designers, Qualitative Researchers, Data Scientists, Engineers and Program Managers. Develop code and statistical models to understand user experience. Conduct empirical research using methods from computer science, quantitative social science, statistics, econometrics, and other fields to understand user behavior and extract meaningful patterns from large data sets. Examine existing data and product designs to generate hypotheses and plans for high-impact research. Prioritize and drive research to improve user experience. Communicate findings to stakeholders in the company. Make research findings convincing and actionable for both research experts and non-experts.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Company Overview

ID.me is a high-growth enterprise software company that simplifies how people prove and share their identity online. The company empowers people to control their data through a portable and trusted login, which means they don’t need to create a new password when visiting sites that have the ID.me button. ID.me’s digital identity network has over 117 million registered members, and is used by fourteen federal agencies, agencies in 30 states and over 600 corporations for secure identity proofing and verification.

ID.me’s technology meets the federal standards for consumer authentication set by the Commerce Department and is approved as a NIST 800-63-3 IAL2 / AAL2 credential service provider by the Kantara Initiative. In addition to helping people control their credentials and data, the company’s “No Identity Left Behind” initiative strives to expand digital access and inclusion for all people. The company offers multiple pathways to identity verification – online self-serve, live video chat agents, and in person. ID.me is passionate about building a robust identity network that does not compromise access for traditionally underserved groups.

ID.me has received numerous awards including Deloitte’s 2023 Technology Fast 500, Washington Business Journal’s Fastest Growing Companies, Entrepreneur Magazine’s 100 Brilliant Companies and Wall Street Journal’s Startup of the Year finalist. In recent quarters, ID.me announced it raised $132 million in Series D funding, led by Viking Global Investors with participation from CapitalG, Morgan Stanley Counterpoint, FTV Capital, PSP Growth, Auctus Investment Group, Moonshots Capital, and Scout Ventures. Title: Senior Data Analyst - Subscriber Lifecycle Analytics
Description:
About The Role & Team

The Subscriber Lifecycle Analytics team is looking for a Senior Data Analyst who will help to measure, understand, and take action to mitigate subscriber churn across a growing ecosystem of Disney’s streaming service offerings (Disney+, Hulu, and ESPN+). Our team masters exploratory data analysis, advanced reporting, data visualization and storytelling to deliver actionable insights and provide recommendations to drive business decision-making. This team collaborates cross-functionally across the Direct to Consumer organization as well as with stakeholders from business units across The Walt Disney Company to generate insightful, compelling, and strategic analyses. This role will build strong relationships and partner closely with Finance, Business Operations, Business Strategy, and other Analytics teams to ensure the business understands complex retention trends and implications for strategic decision making. The team’s work will drive the development of business and operational plans that are expected to have broad influence at all levels of the organization.

What You'll Do


Communicate complex trends and churn drivers to a wide array of business stakeholders with varying technical expertise from operational teams to executive audiences, both in oral presentations and via written reportsPartner closely with business stakeholders (Product, Business Operations, Finance, Marketing etc.) to identify and unlock opportunities for improved subscriber retentionCreate and maintain operational dashboards in Tableau and Looker to understand performance over time, enable efficient exploratory analysis, and equip partners with self-serve toolsTranslate complex business questions into SQL including proper cohorting, calculations, filtering criteria and/or aggregationsPartner with Data Science teams to uplevel analyses using clustering/segmentation, regression modeling, and/or predictive modeling


Key Qualifications


5+ years of strategic analysis to inform product or business decision making3+ years of hands-on analytical work experience with SQL (ETL ownership, complex transformations, development of “analytical” datasets) Strong analytical skills with the ability to apply business strategy to data analysis and recommendationsAbility to think strategically, analyze and interpret first and third party informationExperience manipulating large data sets and interpreting data trends using a multitude of disparate data sources and toolsExpertise with data exploration and data visualization tools like Tableau or LookerStrong analytical and technical skills to troubleshoot issues, analyze the cause, quickly come-up with possible solutions, document the changes, and communicate organizational impactStrong experience in documenting the data requirements, data strategy, data rules (standardization, cleansing, and validation)


Nice To Haves


Experience in the streaming media industry and/or supporting a direct-to-consumer or subscription-based productExperience in the technology industry and knowledge of how to build and implement data productsExperience presenting data stories to executive audiencesExperience operating in an SDLC environment and deploying code


Required Education


Bachelor’s degree in Analytics, Computer Science, Statistics, Economics, Mathematics, Marketing, a related field, and/or relevant work experience


The hiring range for this position in Santa Monica, CA is $112,600 to $151,000, and in New York, NY is $118,000 to $158,200 per year. The base pay actually offered will take into account internal equity and also may vary depending on the candidate’s geographic region, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience among other factors. A bonus and/or long-term incentive units may be provided as part of the compensation package, in addition to the full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the level and position offered.
